question: Question_B_02_(b)
statement:
The matrix

\begin{align*}A = \left[\begin{array}{ccc}
2 & 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 2 & 1 \\ 1 & 1 & 2
\end{array}\right]\end{align*}

is known to have eigenvalues 1 and 4.

\textbf{(b)} Find two linearly independent eigenvectors that correspond
to eigenvalue 1.
hints:
Recall that eigenvectors with eigenvalue $\lambda$ satisfy

\begin{align*}(A-\lambda{}I)\mathbf{x}=\mathbf{0}\end{align*}
